LanguageData.BeowulFMJ.label: .50 Beowulf FMJ
LanguageData.BeowulFMJ.description: Standard .50 Beowulf Full Metal Jacket, jack in all trade, master of none
LanguageData.BeowulAPI.label: .50 Beowulf API
LanguageData.BeowulAPI.description: .50 Beowulf Armor Piercing Incendiary ammo, good counter medium armored target
LanguageData.BeowulHP.label: .50 Beowulf HP
LanguageData.BeowulHP.description: .50 Beowulf Hollow Point ammo, good counter light or non-armored target
LanguageData.BeowulEMP.label: .50 Beowulf EMP
LanguageData.BeowulEMP.description: .50 Beowulf ElectroMagnetic Pulse ammo, can stun/paralize machine and cause electric burn
LanguageData.TuFAP.label: 13.2x92mm SR TuF (AP)
LanguageData.TuFAP.description: The Mauser 13.2mm TuF (German: Tank und Flieger; lit. "tank and aircraft", known also as 13.2×92mmSR) cartridge, was a major step in the development of anti-tank cartridges, being the first one designed for the sole purpose of destroying armored targets.
LanguageData.TuFAPHE.label: 13.2x92mm SR TuF (APHE)
LanguageData.TuFAPHE.description: Due the catridge became obsolete after the war, the surplus ammo are filled with small amount explosive payload to increase its damage counter light armored vehicle and soft target, the modification reduce its penetration capability quite bit.
